result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony K Bagwell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for Restitution and Surcharges

miscConds.notes: Restitution to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.
Defendant can petition court for expunction, if and when he successfully completes Probation.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
No alcohol/drugs.
Not to use or possess of alcohol/drugs without a valid prescription.
No contact with Target, Mega Media or Game Stop.
Submit to random urine screens.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.
Defendant to pay the remaining balance of restitution ($5,024.00)

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Character letter from Sammy's Taste of Chicago filed by Defense
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Anthony K Bagwell in court with attorney Amber K. Rumpf.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- 10 months jail w/huber STAYED for 3 years Probation
- Court Costs of $278.00 (includes DRGOD) to be paid as a Condition of Probation; alternate 6 days jail consecutive
- Restitution of $5024.00 (balance) to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation; alternate 5 days jail consecutive
- Conditions of  Probation: Defendant is to pay the remaining balance of restitution.  Maintain absolute sobriety - no alchol/drugs. No use or possession of alcohol/drugs without a valid prescription. No contact with Target, Mega Media or Game Stop.  Random UA's.  Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. Maintain full-time employment and/or school. DNA Sample if not yet provided.
 - 2 months jail Condition Time (nonworking hours) commencing November 13, 2014 by 6:00 p.m..  Non-working hours with standard release conditions.

Defense requests expungement.
Court doesn't think society would be harmed if probation successfully completed - defendant to petition the court.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony K Bagwell in court with attorney Amber K. Rumpf.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests a plea/sentencing date. Defendant needs to pay restitution.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony K Bagwell in court with attorney Amber K. Rumpf.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests another date. Charge may be amended if half of restitution is paid. Court grants request.  Hearing scheduled for September 5, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Defendant to have no contact with Target Store listed in criminal complaint and no contact with codefendant or witness Jordan K. listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Anthony K Bagwell in court with attorney Amber K. Rumpf.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing, bound over. Information filed, reading waived.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for August 11, 2014 at 09:30 am.
